introduction: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:
text:
• Emily Roebling (1843–1903) was instrumental in the construction of the Brooklyn Bridge.
• She took over many chief engineer duties when her husband Washington Roebling became ill.
• She communicated daily with construction crews and oversaw major design decisions.
• Her expertise impressed politicians and engineers who visited the site.
• The bridge opened in 1883 and was recognized as one of the greatest engineering feats of its era.
question: The student wants to underscore Emily Roebling’s pivotal role in the Brooklyn Bridge’s construction. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?
A: Emily Roebling communicated with construction crews and worked closely with her husband Washington.
B: When Washington Roebling became ill, Emily Roebling effectively acted as chief engineer, overseeing construction and design decisions for the Brooklyn Bridge.
C: Opening in 1883, the Brooklyn Bridge was considered an engineering marvel of its time.
D: Politicians and engineers who visited the construction site were impressed by Emily Roebling’s knowledge.
explanation: Choice B clearly shows Emily Roebling’s major influence on the project by identifying how she took on the duties of chief engineer, fulfilling the goal of highlighting her pivotal role.
